alert.note: Alert for Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 04 at 11:22AM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Shingle Creek At Campbell affecting Osceola County. .Historic rainfall from Hurricane Ian has Shingle Creek at Campbell in Major Flood Stage. The river remains well above Record Flood Stage and crested on Saturday at around 64.2 feet. A very slow decline will occur through late week, but levels will remain in Major Flood Stage. Interests along the river should expect major flood impacts through this week. For the Shingle Creek...including Campbell...Major flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1100 PM EDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Shingle Creek At Campbell. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 62.3 feet, Water enters many homes in Good Samaritan Village. Water approaches Sherwood Forest manufactured homes. Streets in Camelot and Sherwood Forest not navigable by regular vehicles. Property and roads in southern Old Town receiving water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 63.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM EDT Tuesday was 63.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 62.9 feet late this morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 60.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun Shingle Creek Campbell 60.0 63.0 Tue 8 am 62.5 62.1 MSG MSG MSG &&
